page.title: 04HOUSING IN THORNABY
page.content: Most of the houses in the northern part of{Thornaby}were built over a 100 years ago. They are terraced houses and do not have gardens. When they were built they did not have bathrooms but many of them had bathrooms built on to them. Some of them have been demolished because they were not suitable for large families. Many people who used to live in these houses are now living in modern houses on the old{airfield site}in the south of the town. The houses in the centre of{ {Thornaby}are nearly all semi-detached houses.They have front and back gardens,and they all have bathrooms. Some of these houses are owned by the Borough Council and the families pay rent for them.Other houses are owned by the families who live in them.
